page.title: 10RELIGION
page.content: Stanhoe & Barwick has two places of worship, the late 13th century parish church of All Saints and the Methodist Church built in 1892. A former nonconformist building of 1827 is still standing. Except for the years between 1963 and 1970 the church has been administered since 1221 by a Rector but 1985 has seen a change and the parish has been amalgamated with its three near neighbours, Bagthorpe, Bircham and Docking with one Priest-in-Charge of all four. Though small there is still an active Mothers' Union. The Methodist Church is served by a Superintendent, a Minister and local Preachers and has a Sunday School. Both the Parish and the Methodist Church have recently undergone major restoration, the cost being met impartially by the village.
